info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 5:24PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Pecos and north central Brewster Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 524 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Marathon, or 33 miles east of Alpine, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Pecos and north central Brewster Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
